By providing a clear picture of potential threats, TaMaCare allows medics to navigate the battlefield with greater awareness and minimise their exposure to danger.
  • Post-action analysis: The digital twin allows for an after action analysis of the decision and actions that were made, allowing to draw lessons for future interventions.

The benefits of TaMaCare extend beyond immediate casualty care and contribute to a broader strengthening of defence capabilities. In fact, the project fosters advancements in 3D mapping, threat detection/assessment through image processing, and Ultra-Wide Band (UWB) localization networks. These advancements have broader applications for military and civilian operations and for intelligence gathering: planning for offensive/defensive operations, re-assessment of the geometrical environment after man-made or natural calamities, improved navigation of unmanned vehicles, removal of UXO/IED (Unexploded Ordnance/Improvised Explosive Devices), etc.


Your role

The research in TaMaCare will be performed by a Belgian consortium. The role of the researcher hired for this job offer will focus on the development of AI models and ML techniques to facilitate, automate and simplify detection of threats on the battlefield using electromagnetic (panchromatic, multispectral or hyperspectral) sensors in the visible and infrared spectrum based on their spatial or spatio-spectral signature. This knowledge will also be applied to other projects within RMA with similar needs.


Required skills

Technical skills

The applicant shall have a Master Degree in Engineering Science, Applied Sciences, Civil Engineering, Physics, Computer Science or Mathematics.

  • Training or experience in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and/or Deep Learning is essential;
  • Experience in programming with C++ or Python is essential;
  • Experience with OpenCV, PyTorch or Tensorflow is highly recommended;
  • Experience with Computer Vision is highly recommended;
  • Experience with the Robotic Operating System (ROS) or Linux is recommended;
  • Training or experience in multi- or hyperspectral imaging or other EO technologies is an added value;
  • Training or experience in processing of large scale data is an added value;
  • Training or experience in agile workflow methodologies is an added value;
  • Training or experience in applied, collaborative research is an added value;

Other skills

  • The applicant shall have very good knowledge of English (oral / written).
  • The applicant shall preferably have knowledge of either French or Dutch and a minimum knowledge of the other language in order to allow collaboration with peers. This will be tested during the selection process.

Specific requirements

  • Interest in starting a PhD is an added value.
  • The researcher may be exposed to classified information and will therefore have to obtain the required security clearance. The candidate must consent with the background check required to obtain this clearance, which will be executed by the Belgian Defence.
  • A driver’s licence valid in Belgium is an added value.
  • Working for the Patrimony requires living in Belgium for the duration of the study.


Application

You will be working in a military environment. That is why everyone is expected to undergo a security verification. A passport issued by a country that is both member of the EU and NATO is required. Please add to your application the filled-out document. The form can be downloaded from:

http://www.rma.ac.be/nl/aanvraag-veiligheidsverificatie (Dutch) or

https://rma.ac.be/sites/default/files/2021-03/Demande%20d%27Avis%20de%20S%C3%A9curit%C3%A9_F.pdf (French).

There is unfortunately no English version of this document.

Please send your complete application by e-mail. Incomplete applications will not be considered. We do not accept applications via LinkedIn. Send ALL of the following elements to Prof Dr ir Rob HAELTERMAN (rob.haelterman@mil.be), ir Charles HAMESSE (charles.hamesse@mil.be) and Dr ir Helena BRUYNINCKX (erm-deao-rswo@mil.be):

  • a CV and a motivational letter
  • a scan of your ID card (both sides);
  • the filled-out security document (Please do not forget to sign & add the denomination “GELEZEN EN GOEDGEKEURD” (Dutch) or “LU ET APPROUVE” (French))
  • your relevant publications (a link to an online open access repository is acceptable)

Please mention clearly the reference of the project in the subject line of your mail: “TaMaCare”.

(Mails received without this reference or applications sent other than by email to all the above addresses will not be considered. Applications that do not contain all the above elements will also not be considered.)

Application deadline: 16th of August 2024

The interviews will take place at the Royal Military Academy, Hobbemastraat 8, 1000 Brussels. In specific cases, on-line interviews can take place. The date and time of the interview will be communicated to the preselected candidates.


Contract

  • Date of selection: September 26th 2024
  • Start of contract: December 1st 2024.
  • This contract depends on the acceptance of a study proposal. Acceptance will only be known on September 25th. This means that the job offer is currently provisional until that date.
  • Status: Full-time employment (38 hours / week) based on an open-ended contract with the Patrimony of the Royal Military Academy (you will not be a civil servant).
  • To be very clear: your contract will be open-ended, but the financing of the contract will be tied to a project that ends on November 30th 2027. The financing of your contract beyond that period is therefore not 100% guaranteed. However, the chance that we will be able to offer a follow-up project beyond that date is high.
  • Wage scale: class A1 (holder of a Master's Degree in Science, doctor’s degree in the same area of expertise); class A2 (holder of an Ir degree or equivalent Master's degree in Engineering Sciences, doctor’s degree in the same area of expertise). RMA-Patrimony applies a merit-based research career track, allowing researchers to advance in wage scale based upon annual evaluations.
  • Holiday pay.

Extra-legal benefits

  • Possibility to benefit from a bilingualism allowance (Dutch/French) following a SELOR test;
  • End-of-year bonus;
  • Free DKV hospitalization insurance. Possibility of additional affiliation for one or more persons living under the same roof: spouse, child(ren) (50% of the price per additional member);
  • Bike allowance / Free public transport (home-work commute);
  • Free access to campus sports facilities outside working hours;
  • On-campus restaurant and cafeteria with democratic prices (discount on the daily menu);
  • Meal vouchers (6€/day)
  • Flexible working hours within the 38-hour week + Teleworking possible with allowance;
  • Holidays o 29 days holiday / year from the 1st year of contract (then from 45 years: +1 day holiday every 5 years) o + 1 week OFF every year between Christmas and New year’s Eve
  • Advantages and interesting offers thanks to the Benefits@work card (discounts, vouchers...);
  • Entitlement to services offered by the ‘Office Central d'Action Sociale et Culturelle de la Défense’ (OCASC): among others holiday centres, discount on travel organised by the tour operator...;
  • Possibility of benefiting from the nursery funded by Belgian Defence (subject to availability).


Workplace

  • Royal Military Academy, Avenue de la Renaissance 30, 1000 Brussels;
  • Occasional travels abroad for scientific conferences, etc.

Points of contact

  • Concerning the research project: to Prof Dr ir Rob HAELTERMAN (rob.haelterman@mil.be )
  • Concerning the recruitment modalities: Dr ir Helena Bruyninckx (erm-deao-rswo@mil.be)
  • For more information about the Royal Military Academy, see http://www.rma.ac.be

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About FURTHER

FURTHER is the leading AI-powered customer acquisition platform for senior care and healthcare organizations. Our digital experience platform and sales automation solutions make it easier for consumers to buy and easier for sales teams to sell, increasing conversion rates and driving incremental revenue for our clients. FURTHER is the only data platform in the industry that connects first-party marketing and sales data, making it easier for client marketing teams to be data-driven. FURTHER works with over 4,500 care communities and delivered $1.5B of revenue to our customers in 2023.

The Role

At Further, we transform data into actionable insights to drive our systems and solutions. We seek a creative and curious LLM engineer to join our team. If you have a Natural Language Processing and Software Engineering background, you’ll thrive in this role by developing and improving robust conversational agents that take their users to the next level. You'll collaborate with specialists to "slice and dice" data, develop conversational agents, identify enhancements, and deliver innovative solutions.


Collaborate with product design and engineering teams to understand business and data needs.
Develop, test, and deploy robust conversational agents that meet user needs and project requirements.
Continuously improve the natural language understanding (NLU) and overall performance of conversational agents through customization and optimization techniques.
Implement context-aware conversations and design conversation flows that handle complex user queries effectively.
Develop and execute test plans to assess agent performance, identifying areas for improvement and iterating on data, prompts, and workflows.
Communicate findings to stakeholders effectively.
Stay current with industry developments and technical advancements.


What You’ll Own


Collect, clean, and preprocess data to ensure quality and reliability.
Explore and visualize data to identify patterns, trends, and relationships
Train, evaluate, and deploy customized LLMs.
Test and refine models to ensure their effectiveness.
Monitor model performance and make necessary adjustments.
Present results and suggestions through clear visuals and concise reports.


What You’ll Bring


At least 5 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist or Engineer
Business level English verbal and writing.
A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
A minimum of two years experience as an ML engineer.
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools like SQL and Pandas.
Familiarity with Data Warehousing.
Experience in developing, evaluating, deploying, running, and maintaining ML models.
A strong understanding of AI agents, natural language processing, and machine learning concepts.
At least 5 years of experience using LLMs and LLM-enabled programs in a professional, academic, or personal context, including exploring how they work and how to use them effectively.
Experience with LangChain or other AI agent frameworks.
Experience with LLM observability.
Familiarity with the optimal use of LLMs, the tradeoff between fine-tuning and RAG, etc.
Familiarity with prompt engineering best practices.
Familiarity with data structures for ML and AI programs, including RAG and vector databases.
Experience with building systems and infrastructure is preferred.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.


Equal Opportunity Employer

We hire talented and passionate people from a variety of backgrounds because we want our global employee base to represent the wide diversity of our customers. If you’re excited about a role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every bullet point listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. If you’re a builder at heart, share our company values, and enthusiastic about making software toolmaking ubiquitous, we want to hear from you.

FURTHER is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. FURTHER considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. FURTHER is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Experience in using the suite of PowerApps;
  • Experience with languages like R, Python, PERL;
  • Experience in data visualization using power BI;
  • Excellent knowledge of Power app developer, low code and no code development;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;
  • Excellent knowledge of continuous code delivery and unit testing;
  • Excellent knowledge of SharePoint Online;
  • Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData…);
  • Good knowledge of ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio…);
  • Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Certifications in Microsoft Azure would be considered an asset;
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - FREELANCE - Hybrid to Brussels office - EU Citizens Required




Are you a highly skilled data scientist with a passion for extracting insights from complex data sets?




We are seeking a talented Data Scientist to develop and implement advanced data mining solutions to support our client's business objectives.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and deploy data mining and machine learning models
Design and build data pipelines and ETL processes
Create interactive data visualizations
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand requirements
Ensure data privacy and ethical considerations are met




Required Skills:

Strong proficiency in Python and/or R programming
Advanced knowledge of statistics and mathematics
Experience with machine learning algorithms and techniques
Expertise in data manipulation and analysis
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills




Desired Skills:

Experience with deep learning and neural networks
Knowledge of NLP techniques
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI)
French language proficiency
The successful candidate will be part of an international team and will be expected to work collaboratively on multiple projects.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Kindly note that for this position we can consider only EU Nationality citizens.


We are looking for a Data Scientist fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company’s premises or on site at customer premises. 


Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Experience in using the suite of PowerApps;
  • Experience with languages like R, Python, PERL;
  • Experience in data visualization using power BI;
  • Excellent knowledge of Power app developer, low code and no code development;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;
  • Excellent knowledge of continuous code delivery and unit testing;
  • Excellent knowledge of SharePoint Online;
  • Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData…);
  • Good knowledge of ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio…);
  • Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Certifications in Microsoft Azure would be considered an asset.


Tasks:


  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions;
  • Identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution;
  • Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience;
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL);
  • Produce data models according to specific problems statements;
  • Scripting and programming;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc…);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist specialising in Cloud Platforms (m/f/d) for our German client.




Start: beginning / middle of September 2024

before. End: 31.12.2024

Scope: approx. 4 days per week

Location: completely remote possible




Tasks:

* Develop and deploy Natural Language Processing (NLP) models in production environments.

* Work extensively with Large Language Models (LLMs) APIs.

* Engage in prompt-engineering, fine-tuning, and evaluation of LLMs to ensure high performance and relevance.

* Collaborate with cross-functional agile software development teams to integrate LLM solutions into healthcare products.

* Implement MLOps practices to streamline the deployment and maintenance of machine learning models.

* Continuously monitor and improve model performance and adapt to new challenges and datasets.

* Document processes, model architectures, and performance metrics for internal and external stakeholders.

* Stay up to date with advancements in Gen AI




Skills:

* Strong programming skills in languages such as Python and familiarity with NLP libraries and frameworks like PyTorch, Hugging Face, etc.

* Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure

* Successful projects / background in Biotech or Pharma companies

* Experience in prompt-engineering, fine-tuning and evaluation of LLMs.

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.




For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.




You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Science solutions
Going into production with Data Engineers
Creation of POC, model development
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?

You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Ops Engineer - Brussels, Belgium

Are you passionate about MLOps and AI solutions? We are looking for a skilled Machine Learning Ops Engineer to join our team in Brussels.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and deploy AI solutions using Python and popular libraries (e.g., pandas, scikit-learn, xgboost).
Ensure high-quality code through comprehensive testing (unit, integration, end-to-end, performance).
Use data validation and type hints to enhance code quality.
Transform Jupyter notebooks into production-grade code.
Package Python applications/libraries for distribution.
Collaborate using GIT, adhering to best practices for branching, merging, and code reviews.
Work with Machine Learning algorithms, especially in NLP.
Utilize cloud platforms, preferably Azure.
Manage Unix/Linux command line tools and scripting.
Troubleshoot data pipelines and interact with Data Engineering teams.

Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with data processing libraries (e.g., pydantic, pandera).
Familiarity with web frameworks (e.g., FastAPI, Flask).
Knowledge of CLI frameworks (e.g., Typer, Click).
Experience with MLOps tools and frameworks (e.g., MLFlow, Azure ML Studio).
Proficiency in version control for ML datasets and models (e.g., DVC, Azure ML Dataset).
Monitoring libraries (e.g., NannyML, Evidently AI).
Distributed processing frameworks (e.g., Ray, Dask, PySpark).
Pipeline orchestration libraries (e.g., Metaflow, ZenML, Airflow).
General Python development tools (e.g., pytest, black).

Non-Technical Skills:

Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience in large, complex enterprises.
Openness to legacy technology with a drive for modernization.
Up-to-date with new tools and technologies.
Effective team player with Agile project management experience.
Passion for mentoring and sharing knowledge.

Qualifications:

University degree in Software Engineering, Data Science, Machine Learning, Data Engineering, or a related field.
5+ years of experience with Python.
2+ years of experience with DevOps/CI/CD practices.
2+ years of experience deploying AI solutions to production.

To Apply: 📧 Send your CV to ranjani.v@ampstek.com.

HTML:
Machine Learning Ops Engineer - Brussels, Belgium

Are you passionate about MLOps and AI solutions? We are looking for a skilled Machine Learning Ops Engineer to join our team in Brussels.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deploy AI solutions using Python and popular libraries (e.g., pandas, scikit-learn, xgboost).
  • Ensure high-quality code through comprehensive testing (unit, integration, end-to-end, performance).
  • Use data validation and type hints to enhance code quality.
  • Transform Jupyter notebooks into production-grade code.
  • Package Python applications/libraries for distribution.
  • Collaborate using GIT, adhering to best practices for branching, merging, and code reviews.
  • Work with Machine Learning algorithms, especially in NLP.
  • Utilize cloud platforms, preferably Azure.
  • Manage Unix/Linux command line tools and scripting.
  • Troubleshoot data pipelines and interact with Data Engineering teams.

Nice-to-Have Skills:

  • Experience with data processing libraries (e.g., pydantic, pandera).
  • Familiarity with web frameworks (e.g., FastAPI, Flask).
  • Knowledge of CLI frameworks (e.g., Typer, Click).
  • Experience with MLOps tools and frameworks (e.g., MLFlow, Azure ML Studio).
  • Proficiency in version control for ML datasets and models (e.g., DVC, Azure ML Dataset).
  • Monitoring libraries (e.g., NannyML, Evidently AI).
  • Distributed processing frameworks (e.g., Ray, Dask, PySpark).
  • Pipeline orchestration libraries (e.g., Metaflow, ZenML, Airflow).
  • General Python development tools (e.g., pytest, black).

Non-Technical Skills:

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Experience in large, complex enterprises.
  • Openness to legacy technology with a drive for modernization.
  • Up-to-date with new tools and technologies.
  • Effective team player with Agile project management experience.
  • Passion for mentoring and sharing knowledge.

Qualifications:

  • University degree in Software Engineering, Data Science, Machine Learning, Data Engineering, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience with Python.
  • 2+ years of experience with DevOps/CI/CD practices.
  • 2+ years of experience deploying AI solutions to production.

To Apply: 📧 Send your CV to ranjani.v@ampstek.com.

Title: Machine Learning and AI Consultant
Description:
At Uni Systems, we are working towards turning digital visions into reality. We are continuously growing and we are looking for a Machine Learning and AI Consultant to join our UniQue team.

What will you be doing in this role?

Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);
Training of custom machine learning / deep learning models based on structured and unstructured data;
Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques;
Studies and developments aiming at improving the quality of machine translation (MT) engines for each installed language pair, addressing the specific needs of customers of the service concerning MT quality and contributing to a general strategy for the systematic evaluation and long-term improvement of MT quality;
Interact with data stewards and other IT stakeholders to define the data rules;
Define data controls and implement actions to ensure data quality and integrity;
Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance;
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods;
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis;
Design the IT architecture for solutions in the NLP / ML / AI fields, and coordinate its implementation considering master- and meta-data management concepts.



Requirements



What will you be bringing to the team?

Master Degree in IT or related field with at least 13 years of experience in IT.
Extensive hands-on experience with the design and implementation of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG).
Very good knowledge of programming in Python (programming in R is considered an asset).
Very good experience with libraries and frameworks like TensorFlow, Hugging Face, PyTorch, scikitlearn, or Keras.
Very good knowledge with using cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for designing/implementing scalable AI/ML/RAG/etc. solutions.
Extensive hands-on experience with various machine learning algorithms, including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.
Good knowledge of deep learning and neural networks.
Knowledge of the involved Mathematics and Statistics (Linear algebra, Calculus, Probability theory, Statistics, Optimization techniques, etc.).
Good knowledge of data pre-processing and analysis techniques.
Good experience with data visualization using tools like Matplotlib, Seaborn or Plotly.
Good experience with RDBMS like Oracle (latest version).
Good experience of NoSQL databases like MongoDB or Cassandra.
Experience in training deep learning models.
Good knowledge of NLP techniques and libraries like NLTK, spaCy, or Transformers.
Extensive experience with model evaluation and validation techniques.
Extensive experience with deploying ML models to production.
Good knowledge of potential bias and fairness issues in AI systems.
Knowledge of the applicable data privacy regulations (GDPR) and compliance with AI/ML applications will be considered as an asset.
Familiarity with reinforcement learning algorithms and environments.
Familiarity with distributed computing frameworks such as Apache Spark or Hadoop for handling large dataset will be considered an asset.
Fluent in English at least at a level B2.



Benefits



At Uni Systems, we are providing equal employment opportunities and banning any form of discrimination on grounds of gender, religion, race, color, nationality, disability, social class, political beliefs, age, marital status, sexual orientation or any other characteristics. Take a look at our Diversity, Equality & Inclusion Policy for more information.

Title: Data Scientist Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future. With 25 years’ experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you’ll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, product designers, business consultants, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to work with the world’s leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

Are you passionate about data-driven platforms, machine learning models, and innovative applications? As a Data Scientist/Engineer at Devoteam, you'll play a hands-on role in delivering impactful solutions across various clients and industries. Each mission we undertake has clear deliverables and deadlines, ensuring you gain diverse experience. For example, one month you might develop a predictive maintenance model, and the next, a customer segmentation model for a retail client.

Key Responsibilities:

Platform Setup: Design and implement robust data platforms using Azure, AWS or Google Cloud and Databricks.
Data Management: Gather, prepare, and manage data for analysis.
Model Research: Investigate and select appropriate machine learning models.
ML Modeling: Develop and refine machine learning models.
Client Collaboration: Spend approximately 50% of your time working directly with clients, either independently or as part of a team.



Your Role:

Build and maintain data platforms and pipelines using Azure, AWS or Google Cloud, Databricks, and Python.
Develop predictive and machine learning models tailored to client needs.
Advise clients on translating their business requirements into technical solutions using machine learning techniques.
Stay updated on the latest trends in machine learning and AI, sharing insights with clients.
Act as a strategic partner to client Data Science teams, helping them navigate their challenges and aspirations.
Inspire clients with new data-driven opportunities.
Bring best practices in Git, DevOps, and CICD to enhance client data platforms.
Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Business Stakeholders.
Represent Devoteam both online and offline, showcasing our expertise.


Qualifications

About You:

Reside in Belgium.
Hold a university degree in Computer Science, (Business) Engineering, or a specialized master's in Machine Learning or AI.
Have a solid understanding of various machine learning models (e.g., SVM, RNN, Deep Learning) and their applications.
Possess foundational knowledge of Data Science, including sampling techniques and evaluation metrics.
Proficient in SQL and Python.
Experience with Spark and/or cloud ecosystems is a must.
Eager to learn and passionate about data and machine learning technologies.
Excited to join a dynamic and growing team.
Fluent in English; proficiency in Dutch or French is mandatory 



 


Additional Information

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer - MLOps - September Start-date - 12-month contract




Glocomms are currently searching for a Freelance MLOps Engineer to support one of the largest IT Consultancies globally. The ideal candidate will be deeply interested in developing, deploying and maintaining AI applications and is motivated by working in close collaboration with the customer and data team.




About the role:

Location - Brussels, Belgium
Hybrid working
Start date - September 2024
12 month contract
English Speaking (French or Dutch is a huge bonus)
Freelance role - 40 hours p/w




Required skills:

5+ years' experience as a minimum
Strong background in Data Science/ Data Engineering
Deep understanding of Software Engineering - highly skilled using Python
Good knowledge with DevOps - especially in implementing, deploying and setting up CI/CD pipelines (GitHub, Jenkins, etc.)
Experience with advanced version control tools for Machine Learning Datasets and models (DVC, Azure ML dataset versioning, etc.)
Able to successfully design and build continuous integration of AI applications
Any Pharma / Life Science / Bio-informatics experience is a huge plus




Please get in touch to learn more!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Description

We currently have a vacancy for a Data Scientist fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert remotely. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client’s IT team.

Your Tasks

  • Coordination and review of policy units’ business needs;
  • Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks;
  • Creating, designing and developing data models;
  • Analyze large datasets and propose approaches for optimization of reporting;
  • Assessment and quality control of data;
  • Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders;
  • Management and processing of data;
  • Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available;
  • Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI;
  • Assistance with data management aspects of IT projects.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with 5 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;
  • Very good knowledge of reporting and statistics;
  • Good knowledge of Power BI;
  • Experience with one or more of the following: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, Languages like R, Python, PERL, Other business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData…), ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio…);
  • Knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for a Data Scientist. As we are growing fast, we are looking for people to support and participate in this growth. We are looking for a person with a passion for data science, interested in leading concrete business projects in a wide variety of domains and applications.

In this role, you will work closely with other Data Profiles from Python Predictions but also from our clients’ internal teams. You will lead the way and participate in multiple advanced analytics projects from the ideation phase to the value delivery. Every step of the way, you will ensure the quality of the analytical solution as well as the actionability towards the business stakeholders.

Does this sound like your ideal day-to-day drill? Then don’t wait any longer and let’s meet.




Who are we looking for?

You have multiple years of experience in a variety of data science applications (not all, but not limited to one either).
You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information, in order to turn this information into value. You have acquired relevant skills through your past experiences.
You are as proficient in Python as you are in English, Dutch or French (all other (programming) languages are a plus).
You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results. You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input.
You can work independently, but you also appreciate collaboration. You are open-minded and have no fear of expressing your opinion in a constructive way.
You have experience in project management and people management.




What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact.
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting firm. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development.
Great variation in job content due to short and long term missions in different industries, different domains and different environments.
A competitive salary, with plenty of fringe benefits.
A diverse team of supportive colleagues with different backgrounds, skills and interests but shared values who’ll make you feel right at home.
The opportunity to turn these new colleagues into friends during our legendary afterwork drinks and other exciting events.
In-company training adapted to your personal needs.
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time.
A chance to exploit your talents in our Tobania.Academy and on-the-job coaching.
A workstation at one of our customers’ offices, at Python’s Brussels office but also at any Tobania’s location!

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
About Our Client

Our client is an early-stage, deep-tech start-up at the forefront of developing cutting-edge AI-driven technology. They are fueled by a strong sense of mission and enthusiasm, striving to democratize data-driven decision-making on a global scale. They collaborate with leading organizations and are backed by veteran entrepreneurs and angel investors.




Role Overview

We are seeking an ambitious AI Research Engineer to join our client's team in Leuven. This role is instrumental in developing a next-generation financial digital twin powered by a causal, human-in-the-loop, automated, multivariate time-series forecasting engine. This engine utilizes a custom AI stack and proprietary algorithms developed by our client’s technical founders at a renowned machine learning lab.




Key Responsibilities




AI Research and Development:

Conduct research to develop innovative AI models and algorithms.
Experiment with and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve product performance.
Set up experiments to test algorithm performance, evaluate results, and design improvements.
Collaborate with academic and industry partners to stay at the forefront of AI advancements.




Continuous Improvement:

Stay updated with the latest AI research, tools, and technologies.
Identify and suggest improvements to existing AI models and processes for enhanced performance and scalability.
Participate in conferences, workshops, and seminars to keep abreast of AI advancements.




Documentation and Communication:

Create and maintain documentation for research findings, algorithms, and development processes.
Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders regarding research progress, technical challenges, and project requirements.
Assist the CTO in creating technical presentations and reports to intuitively convey complex ideas and roadmaps.




Mentorship and Knowledge Sharing:

Provide guidance and mentorship to junior researchers and interns.
Share knowledge and best practices with the team to foster a collaborative and innovative research environment.




Qualifications




Proven experience (3+ years) in AI research and development, ideally in a startup or fast-paced environment.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and familiarity with AI/ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, SciKit-learn).
Strong understanding of AI techniques, including machine learning, time-series forecasting, probabilistic reasoning, and deep learning.
Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively in a team.
Advanced degree (Master’s or PhD) in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Pragmatic problem-solving skills.




Nice to Haves:

Experience in data engineering, including designing and managing data pipelines and workflows.
Experience with multivariate time-series forecasting (including seasonality and trend analysis).

Show more

  • Conduct research to develop innovative AI models and algorithms.
  • Experiment with and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve product performance.
  • Set up experiments to test algorithm performance, evaluate results, and design improvements.
  • Collaborate with academic and industry partners to stay at the forefront of AI advancements.


Continuous Improvement:

  • Stay updated with the latest AI research, tools, and technologies.
  • Identify and suggest improvements to existing AI models and processes for enhanced performance and scalability.
  • Participate in conferences, workshops, and seminars to keep abreast of AI advancements.


Documentation and Communication:

  • Create and maintain documentation for research findings, algorithms, and development processes.
  • Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders regarding research progress, technical challenges, and project requirements.
  • Assist the CTO in creating technical presentations and reports to intuitively convey complex ideas and roadmaps.


Mentorship and Knowledge Sharing:

  • Provide guidance and mentorship to junior researchers and interns.
  • Share knowledge and best practices with the team to foster a collaborative and innovative research environment.


Qualifications


  • Proven experience (3+ years) in AI research and development, ideally in a startup or fast-paced environment.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and familiarity with AI/ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, SciKit-learn).
  • Strong understanding of AI techniques, including machine learning, time-series forecasting, probabilistic reasoning, and deep learning.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively in a team.
  • Advanced degree (Master’s or PhD) in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Pragmatic problem-solving skills.


Nice to Haves:

  • Experience in data engineering, including designing and managing data pipelines and workflows.
  • Experience with multivariate time-series forecasting (including seasonality and trend analysis).

Title: Machine Learning Engineer 🌎
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer 🌎

Geospatial Data

Location: Remote (European Union)




About Us:

We're partnering with a pioneering tech company that leverages cutting-edge geospatial data and AI to tackle global challenges. Their platform delivers real-time insights and predictive models, empowering organizations to address climate change, streamline supply chains, and make data-driven investment decisions.




The Role:

We're looking for a Geospatial Machine Learning Engineer to craft and implement innovative solutions for diverse industry clients. You'll work with proprietary AI/ML models and develop end-to-end workflows to create product-ready deliverables.

Master's degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or related field
3+ years as a Backend Software Engineer with ML focus
Strong skills in Python, PyTorch, OpenCV, and cloud technologies
Hands-on experience with image segmentation/object detection algorithms
Excellent communication skills and ability to work independently




Nice to Have:

C++ proficiency
Experience with geospatial libraries and enterprise SaaS products
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform




Join us in making a tangible impact on global sustainability and resilience through innovative technology. 🌍

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Freelance - €45 per hour




For our international client we are looking for a Data Scientist to join an international project with our customer.




Project details:

• Start: ASAP

• Duration: 6 month (+ option to extend)

• Workload: 5 days a week

• Location: Remote

• Language: English




Responsibilities:




• In-depth experience in data modelling and using data analytically tools and techniques (e.g., Python, SQL, Hadoop, R, Data Bricks)

• Understanding of vector databases

• In-depth experience with statistical models and data mining algorithms

• Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques such as Natural Language Processing / Text Analytics, Random Forest, Boosting, etc.

• Experience in using advanced machine learning algorithms and models such as: classification, regression, clustering, decision trees, etc.

• Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: Python, C, C++, Java, etc.

• Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) skills

• Understanding of cloud computing and data privacy concepts

• Ability to understand business requirements and project objectives

• Ability to understand and analyze use case data

• Ability to prepare and organize data for data modelling

• Evaluation skills. Assess quality and robustness of models to meet business objectives and adjust models.

• Deployment skills. Deploy models and share results with stakeholders.

• Ability to manage data lakes end to end from creation to maintenance

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
VIATRIS BV

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access – Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;

Leadership – Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and

Partnership – Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here’s how the Data Scientist role will make an impact:

Key Responsibilities for This Role Include:

Enhancing the advancement of CRM systems through the integration of AI technologies, the Data Scientist will support strategic decision-making by leveraging advanced data analytics, predictive models, and machine learning, ultimately enhancing business intelligence and operational efficiency.


Implement and integrate new versions and functionalities of existing CRM systems, in collaboration with Regional and Global teams, to bring system capabilities to the next level.
Manage and optimize the existing CRM systems to ensure accurate and up-to-date customer data.
Ensure that data management procedures are up-to-date and provide end-users training on CRM functionalities.
Analyse large and complex datasets using AI techniques to identify patterns and deliver insights for strategic decision-making.
Develop and implement predictive models, machine learning algorithms, and AI-driven statistical analyses to support the transformation of business operations.
Perform regular data audits to identify and rectify inaccuracies or inconsistencies, ensuring higher data quality.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to communicate insights and performance metrics to internal stakeholders.



The minimum qualifications for this role are:


Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Management, Marketing or a related field.
Minimum 3-5 years experience in supporting the business goals and needs.
Fluent in FR and/or NL, with strong EN capabilities
In-depth knowledge of CRM systems (Salesforce, Veeva)
Good understanding of programming languages (Python, R, Java, or others)
Experience with Power BI
Experience in data management and model development
Strong business acumen and capability to translate business requirements into data modelling.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.



At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Position Overview

Join ARRISE, a leading supplier of player-favorite content to the iGaming industry, as a dynamic and dedicated Data Scientist. In this demanding yet rewarding role, you will leverage cutting-edge technologies like computer vision, natural language processing, and deep learning to redefine the gaming experience. With a laser focus on excellence, you will push your limits to deliver advanced solutions, collaborating with cross-functional teams on complex challenges.

About You

You are a passionate and self-driven Data Scientist who thrives in a fast-paced environment. Your analytical mindset and strong problem-solving and communication skills allow you to easily navigate complex problem statements. You are driven by innovation and eager to stay updated on the latest trends in recommender systems, machine learning, and data engineering. Mistakes are growth opportunities, and you approach them with a positive, learning-focused attitude.

What You Will Do


Design and develop advanced ML algorithms for image, text, audio, and tabular data
Develop and optimize pipelines in Azure to train models across various domains
Implement end-to-end applications in Python, including unit and integration tests
Continuously monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to produce solutions to complex problems
Develop common packages and tools for logging, model inference, and more



Required Qualifications And Experience


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Strong proficiency in Python, PyTorch, and TensorFlow
Proven experience in managing and analyzing large datasets
Solid understanding of foundational DL algorithms
Expertise in unit and integration tests (Pytest) and CICD pipelines
Experience with data versioning, model management, experiment tracking, key evaluation metrics, and optimization techniques
Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience in Docker
Solid understanding of traditional Computer Vision and classical ML



Nice to Have


In-depth experience with computer vision models for object detection, image classification, and segmentation
Experience with Azure services (ML Studio, Data Factory, Functions, Blob Storage) or equivalent cloud provider services
Knowledge of AWS (Amazon Web Services) services, especially EC2 and S3
Experience with Huggingface Transformers, Elastic Stack, Gitlab CI pipelines
Experience with Prompt Engineering, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), LLM frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, Haystack, ...), and fine-tuning LLMs



Benefits


Highly competitive salary
Detailed company training on the highest standards
Friendly and supportive culture
Tremendous growth opportunities in a large, fast-moving international company



About Us

ARRISE, a leading supplier of player-favorite content to the iGaming industry. We are a software development and services company delivering end-to-end digital solutions. Headquartered in Gibraltar with offices around the world, including Malta, Romania, India, Canada, and Bulgaria, we are a global team of over 5,000 talented individuals with decades of experience across multiple industries and professions. Together, we form a cross-functional powerhouse that is driven to deliver.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

We are currently seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team at Amaris Consulting, located in Belgium. This role is a unique opportunity for those passionate about AI and machine learning, looking to apply their skills in a challenging yet rewarding environment.

🔥Your Responsibilities:



Developing machine learning models from scratch and improving existing ones
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide appropriate solutions.
Data preprocessing including data cleaning, normalization, and transformation.
Evaluating model performance using suitable metrics and validation techniques
Maintaining clear documentation of the development process for future reference and audits
Staying updated with the latest trends in machine learning algorithms, tools, industry best practices
Promoting knowledge sharing within the team through presentations or workshops on new findings or technologies related to ML/AI
Troubleshooting any issues that arise during the development or deployment of ML models



🎯 Your Profile:

The ideal candidate is a recent graduate who has a strong passion for artificial intelligence (AI) & machine learning (ML). You should be eager to learn new things continuously while being able to work effectively as part of a diverse team.



A bachelor’s degree in computer science/engineering/mathematics or related field is required; a masters degree is advantageous.
Familiarity with Python programming language along with libraries such as TensorFlow/Keras/PyTorch used in ML applications.
An understanding of various Machine Learning algorithms like Regression Models, Decision Trees etc., along with their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Good understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
An analytical mindset with problem-solving skills.
Ability to troubleshoot complex software issues
Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders
Able to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and French or Dutch.
Minimum 1 to 7 years of experience.



 🚀 Advantages:



An international learning environment
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.  



💡 We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for..

a data scientist with a strong knowledge in machine and deep learning to strengthen the activities of our innovation team and Earth Observation activities. GIM uses an open innovation approach to respond flexibly to our rapidly changing ecosystem and to continuously renew our products and services portfolio.







Below you will not find a standard vacancy, you will read a short story about where you will make the difference. Do you want work with us on a society in which geospatial data empower people to live better lives and make better decisions? Get in touch!







As experienced data science professional

I am the driving force behind our Earth Observation AI developments that are used for the further extension of our Belmap product and on customer projects. I actively follow-up new developments and technologies in the data science / machine learning / deep learning & computer vision domains. I provide technical input for research proposals centered around AI for GEO and Earth Observation, and implement the resulting innovation projects.




I contribute to our excellent customer experience by supporting my sales colleagues on their customer visits and contribute to the (pre)sales process by thinking along with the customer, delivering technical advice and giving demos. Together with the team, I translate the customer needs into a concrete project strategy and set up an action plan to ensure the successful delivery of the customer solution. My fluency in Dutch (mandatory!) as well as English, is a big asset in this context. I keep an eye on the project agreements that were made regarding budget, planning and deadlines, and contribute to great project results. My experience with working on complex projects and my excellent communication skills ensure that we create win-win situations with our customers.




I keep up-to-date on the newest technical and scientific developments within the machine learning, Earth Observation and geotechnology domains and share my knowledge with my GIM colleagues. By continuously renewing this technological knowledge and applying it to rapidly evolving customer demands, I also help to ensure that GIMs' products and services portfolio continues to meet the future needs of customers.







What do we offer you?

At GIM we are convinced that employees make the difference. This is why we give them every opportunity to shine in a self-organizing context where we distribute clear areas of responsibility with lots of decision power. We offer you a versatile function in a dynamic and highly innovative company, excellent working conditions and real possibilities for career development. Our salary packages are market conform with excellent fringe benefits, and we give you the choice to opt for a mobility budget, fitting to your personal needs.

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Was erwartet Sie?

Programmierung von KI-Programmen
Analyse und Weiterverwertung von Daten
Identifizierung von Anwendungsbereichen für KI
Datenbasierte Weiterentwicklung von maschinellen Lernprogrammen
Eigeninitiative Umsetzung von KI-Projekten
Schulung und Kapazitätenaufbau im Bereich künstlicher Intelligenz
Testen von neuen Tools und Anwendungen




Was sollten Sie mitbringen?

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
OfferFit was founded by ex-McKinsey and BCG math PhDs, and we’re funded by leading Silicon Valley VCs. OfferFit replaces A/B testing with AI testing, powered by reinforcement learning AI. This allows lifecycle marketers to test & improve the performance of their campaigns much faster than before. Customers include leading brands like Brinks Home, Yelp, Engie, and MetLife, among many others.




Note for Applicants:




Data shows that men on average apply for a role if they meet 6/10 requirements while women often only do so if it’s 10/10. We work hard to be clear and specific about what our roles require, and we encourage you to apply even if you don’t check all the boxes! Applying gives you the opportunity to be considered and we look forward to reviewing your application!




Position Overview:




Do you enjoy working on data-intensive products and being involved in projects from an early stage? Come join our quickly growing Engineering team to help design, improve and scale OfferFit's self-learning (reinforcement learning) AI platform.




In particular, you will:




Use robust software engineering best practices to design, implement, and improve modular components in a cutting-edge ML product.
Work closely with customer-facing teams to understand, translate, and generalize particular use cases to generic platform components.
Apply your extensive knowledge of Python and its ecosystem to produce clean, readable, and extendible code, and coach others on the team in doing the same.
Collaborate with teams responsible for OfferFit’s product strategy and roadmap.
Support teams implementing OfferFit for customers to ensure their success.
Work closely with our Applied Science team (data scientists) to help productize and deploy attribution and reinforcement learning algorithm improvements
Improve our core data pipelines and reporting architecture.




Tech stack:




Data Science/Back End: Python (Pandas, Polars, Ibis, Spark), SQL, BigQuery, FastAPI
Web [Not required for this role]: JavaScript (Vue, Node.js), HTML, CSS
Architecture/DevOps: Kubernetes, Airflow, Terraform, GCP
We write well-tested, type-hinted, documented, modular code and use pre-commit hooks, CI/CD, and issue tracking for development.




Why is it great:




No toy datasets in notebooks — we’re implementing AI pipelines in production at scale!

Learn tons about data architecture, data science, and self-learning AI.
Work in a team that not only talks the talk of development best practices, but walks the walk — unit & integration tests, modular design, CI/CD, pair programming, code reviews — the works.
Join OfferFit’s fast-paced, supportive, and professional team. We make sure all of our team members are empowered and receive great mentorship and coaching.




Who’s a Fit:




Exceptional coder: you write clean, object-oriented code; you care about good design and terse, testable APIs.
Tinkerer: you regularly explore and learn new technologies and methods, especially in the data architecture and data science domains.
Entrepreneurial: you proactively identify opportunities and risks, work around obstacles, and always seek creative ways to improve processes and outcomes.
Structured and organized: you can structure a plan, align stakeholders, and see it through to execution.
Clear communicator: you are able to express yourself clearly and persuasively, both in writing and speech.
Background in Machine Learning Engineering and/or Data Engineering is preferred. Some Data Science experience is nice-to-have but is not required.




Ideal Skills and Experience:




2+ years of experience working with Python in a production setting, including 1+ years in the data / machine learning ecosystem
Experience working with at least one major cloud platform (GCP, AWS, Azure, etc.)
Experience putting ML models into production
General understanding of supervised learning principles is a plus but not required




OfferFit Benefits and Perks:




Generous PTO (starting at 25 days PTO per year) and Parental leave policy (12 weeks paid)
100% remote work environment with flexible hours
Quarterly gatherings where we meet in person in a different city to work together, bond as a team and celebrate our progress
Weekly team events (lunch and learns, trivia, virtual escape rooms, town hall and team health “barometer” meetings)
Ability to learn and develop from an experienced leadership team (ex-Amazon, McKinsey, BCG, and IBM, among others) who are focused on building a talented, diverse, and inclusive team
Dedication to building a strong culture (e.g., team resource groups, weekly recognitions, major life event celebrations, mental health/sustainability days off, etc.)




Additional Requirements:




Fluency in English is required for this position
Ability to partially overlap with US time zones required

100% remote work environment with flexible hours
Quarterly gatherings where we meet in person in a different city to work together, bond as a team and celebrate our progress
Weekly team events (lunch and learns, trivia, virtual escape rooms, town hall and team health “barometer” meetings)
Ability to learn and develop from an experienced leadership team (ex-Amazon, McKinsey, BCG, and IBM, among others) who are focused on building a talented, diverse, and inclusive team
Dedication to building a strong culture (e.g., team resource groups, weekly recognitions, major life event celebrations, mental health/sustainability days off, etc.)




Please note that we adjust compensation for non–US countries using a relative cost of labor adjustment between the US and your country of residence. Applicants should apply via OfferFit’s internal or external careers site.




OfferFit is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. OfferFit is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.

As an ML Engineer, you will help our clients building and serving machine learning models. More specifically, the responsibilities include:

Design and implement solutions to serve machine learning models, from traditional ML to Generative AI.
Train, improve, and deploy ML models.
Write production ready code and serve online, batch, and real time models
Identify, design, and implement process improvements in the machine learning lifecylce: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Collaborate with Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers and Data Engineers, to integrate all parts of the solution.
Coach colleagues and clients in your area of expertise







Who are we looking for?

Required

Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, or related field.
At least 3 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, MLOps Engineer, or in a similar position.
Strong software engineering background
Experience deploying machine learning in production
Experience with experiment tracking, models monitoring, and deployment strategies
Ability to write production ready code in Python.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and understanding of Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of containers and container orchestration.
Master software engineering best practices and software release cycle.
Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider.
Knowledge of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka.
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction.Experience building, scheduling and maintaining ML pipelines
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus







What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to shape the future of AI? Clario are looking for a visionary AI Engineer to propel our innovative journey forward in the clinical trials and pharmaceutical industries. Dive into the heart of AI research and development, where your expertise in machine learning, deep learning, and software engineering will fuel transformative solutions that redefine business success and directly impact the lives of patients globally.




What we offer

Competitive compensation
Attractive benefits (security, flexibility, support and well-being)
Remote or hybrid working
Full technology setup and support




What you'll be doing

The AI Engineer will play a key role in researching, designing, developing, and implementing AI-based solutions that drive business objectives and contribute to the advancement of our AI capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and software engineering, along with a passion for tackling challenging problems using AI techniques.

Research, design, and implement ML/Deep Learning models applied to natural language processing, data classification, and other areas.
Design and implement solutions leveraging state of the art GenAI models, including Large Language models.
Participate in the fine-tuning of LLMs, including the preparation of data sets.
Perform required accuracy measures and model validations.
Collaborate with product managers, domain experts, and medical scientists to define requirements.
Partner with software engineers for seamless integration of AI models, ensuring operational success.
Engage with scientific literature to stay ahead of emerging trends.
Drive automation and efficiency improvements in our workflows.
Provide support to internal teams, facilitating resolution of technical issues.
Identify and pursue new opportunities to add value to the organization and departmental processes.
Foster a collaborative environment, supporting colleagues in achieving collective and individual goals.




What we look for

Degree in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, Physics, or a related field
3+ Years of experience Developing natural language processing models/applications with a proficiency in programming languages such as Python or C++
Performing model training across different model architectures and data modalities
Strong understanding of various Deep Learning techniques.
Past experience developing AI models for the healthcare and life science industry a plus.
Solid understanding of machine learning tools and techniques (e.g., Pytorch, Keras, TensorFlow, Pandas, Scikit-learn).
Familiarity with software and systems engineering concepts, including cloud computing, continuous integration, and continuous deployment (CI/CD) is a plus.
Exceptional motivational and team-building skills, fostering a collaborative and inclusive team environment. Ability to work in group setting and independently.
Ability to organize and prioritize assigned tasks to meet established schedules, timelines, or deadlines.
Problem solving abilities.
Excellent attention to detail and meticulous work.




At Clario, we put people first, always. We are united and driven by patients, committed to making a difference, and we are always looking for the best talent to help us transform lives. We value the contribution each of our people brings. It’s only through our people that we can continue to innovate technology that will shape the future of clinical trials.




Clario is committed to providing an inclusive workplace that welcomes diversity and equal opportunity. We encourage all qualified candidates who are passionate about sustainability, ethical business, and making a positive impact to apply for this role.

Title: Applied Machine Learning Research Engineer
Description:
Senior Applied Machine Learning Researcher - Distributed Model Training

Remote




We're hiring for a Machine Learning Researcher for a Series A start-up (over 50 million in funding and backed by top investors). The team are pushing the boundaries of machine learning research in a decentralized and heterogeneous environment. The mission is to train highly distributed models over uniquely decentralized infrastructure, revolutionizing the way neural networks are built and deployed.




Responsibilities:




Train models on decentralized and heterogeneous infrastructure, focusing on high-volume model training.
Serve as a bridge between researchers generating novel ideas and production engineers implementing them.
Manage and maintain experimental frameworks and test benches for ML research.
Provide engineering support, addressing reproducibility and other ML-related issues.
Follow best practices in design, testing, and documentation of code.
Publish research papers for top-tier AI conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AAAI, IJCAI) and collaborate with academic and research institutions.




Minimum Requirements:




Strong background in applied machine learning with hands-on experience in training models.
Proficient in building and managing distributed systems.
Strong coding skills with a focus on running experiments rather than developing novel concepts.
Comfortable working in a high-autonomy, unpredictable research environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.




Preferred Qualifications:




Experience with highly distributed model training.




Please apply for more details, we're looking forward to hearing from you

Show more
